name: Coconut Cream Pie Bars
description: Coconut Cream Pie Bars are made with a buttery cookie crust, a rich and velvety coconut cream filling, and vanilla whipped cream.

itemListElement.text: In a blender or food processor, blend the vanilla wafers into a sandy consistency.
itemListElement.name: In a blender or food processor, blend the vanilla wafers into a sandy consistency.

itemListElement.text: Mix in the melted butter and salt until the cookie crumbs are completely saturated and have deepened in color.
itemListElement.name: Mix in the melted butter and salt until the cookie crumbs are completely saturated and have deepened in color.

itemListElement.text: Press the cookie crust into an 11x7-inch baking dish in an even layer and freeze. If you don't have an 11x7-inch dish, use any square or rectangle dish with a 10-cup (2.5 qt) volume.
itemListElement.name: Press the cookie crust into an 11x7-inch baking dish in an even layer and freeze. If you don't have an 11x7-inch dish, use any square or rectangle dish with a 10-cup (2.5 qt) volume.

itemListElement.text: Add the unsweetened coconut flakes to a large saucepan set over medium heat. Toast the flakes, stirring occasionally so they don't burn. Remove them from the pan when they are golden brown.
itemListElement.name: Add the unsweetened coconut flakes to a large saucepan set over medium heat. Toast the flakes, stirring occasionally so they don't burn. Remove them from the pan when they are golden brown.

itemListElement.text: Add 1 cup of the toasted coconut flakes, the condensed milk, evaporated milk, coconut milk, salt, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and flour to a heavy-bottomed saucepan set over medium heat. Stir until everything is combined and the milk has thickened, about 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Add 1 cup of the toasted coconut flakes, the condensed milk, evaporated milk, coconut milk, salt, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and flour to a heavy-bottomed saucepan set over medium heat. Stir until everything is combined and the milk has thickened, about 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Take the milk mixture off the heat and let it steep for 20 minutes. Use a fine-mesh sieve to strain the coconut flakes from the milk mixture and discard. Add the milk mixture back to the pan and set over medium heat.
itemListElement.name: Take the milk mixture off the heat and let it steep for 20 minutes. Use a fine-mesh sieve to strain the coconut flakes from the milk mixture and discard. Add the milk mixture back to the pan and set over medium heat.

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl, add the water to the egg yolks. Mix in the cornstarch to create a slurry, then add it to the milk mixture in the pan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the custard bubbles in spurts.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl, add the water to the egg yolks. Mix in the cornstarch to create a slurry, then add it to the milk mixture in the pan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the custard bubbles in spurts.

itemListElement.text: Take the pan off the heat and add the butter and vanilla extract. Mix until the butter dissolves.
itemListElement.name: Take the pan off the heat and add the butter and vanilla extract. Mix until the butter dissolves.

itemListElement.text: Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve directly into the chilled crust.  Refrigerate until set, about 2 to 3 hours.
itemListElement.name: Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve directly into the chilled crust.  Refrigerate until set, about 2 to 3 hours.

itemListElement.text: Top with whipped cream topping and sprinkle the whipped cream with the remaining 1/2 cup of toasted coconut flakes.
itemListElement.name: Top with whipped cream topping and sprinkle the whipped cream with the remaining 1/2 cup of toasted coconut flakes.

review.reviewBody: This pie is lovely, but a little disappointing. Too subtle coconut flavour. I even added 2 tsp coconut extract instead of 1 tsp vanilla extract and still very subtle coconut. It is very rich and fairly simple to make. Overall, it turned out yummy, but not the biggest fan.
Amazing and worth the time and effort!!

Do not recommend doing the 5th step using the same saucepan as the 4th - it was too hot by the time I added the flour and just couldn't get it smooth.  My own fault! Still delicious, I just now have a porridge in my sieve and about half the amount of custard.

This recipe is a major yumster! As DH is diabetic, I had to find some work-arounds. I found a sugar free condensed milk recipe online and made a "keto" crust for this using almond flour. The filling recipe still has carbs, even with sugar subs, but my alterations made the result acceptable and absolutely wonderful. Coconut cream pie is a fave in our family and this is so delicious, the calories are totally worth it. Just eat small portions! Thanks, Monti!

keywords: Coconut Cream Pie, Coconut Dessert, Pie Bars
